page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {CHIPPERFIELD}(population about 1800) -Situated roughly 5 miles from Watford Hemel Hempstead and Chesham.With recent construction of the M25,London and areas south are more accessible. The village,in a farming area with no basic local trade or industry,is predominantly a commuter area.The centre has been designated for conservation,and efforts are being made to retain its character. {KINGS LANGLEY}(population about 6000) -Lies 2.5 miles east of Chipperfield, 20 miles north of London and 2 miles south of Hemel Hempstead,in the Gade Valley,on BR mainline and A41 trunk road to Midlands and North-West.A pleasant semi-rural community,though with traffic problems,the nearby M25 and other developments inevitably confront it with massive environmental changes.
